input_data.title: Copper
input_data.overview: Kevin Corcoran is a rugged young Irish immigrant policeman trying to keep the peace in the historical Five Points neighborhood in 1860s New York City while searching for information on the disappearance of his wife and death of his daughter.

response.analytical_summary: Copper is a historical crime drama set in 1860s New York City, specifically the notorious Five Points neighborhood. The series follows a young Irish immigrant police officer as he navigates a corrupt and dangerous environment while grappling with personal tragedy. It blends procedural elements with a character-driven narrative, exploring themes of justice, morality, and the immigrant experience against the backdrop of a rapidly changing urban landscape. The show offers a gritty and often violent portrayal of a pivotal era in American history, examining the social and political tensions that defined the time.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Kevin Corcoran, a newly appointed police officer, arriving in the Five Points, a densely populated and impoverished area rife with crime and corruption. Haunted by the loss of his wife and daughter, Kevin seeks solace and purpose in upholding the law, quickly clashing with both criminals and corrupt officials within the police force. He becomes entangled in a complex web of political intrigue, uncovering a conspiracy that reaches the highest levels of New York society. As Kevin investigates, he forms uneasy alliances with various characters, including a madam who runs a local brothel and a hardened detective with his own agenda. Throughout the series, Kevin confronts his past traumas while striving to bring justice to the Five Points, facing betrayals and moral compromises along the way. While Kevin makes strides in bringing some criminals to justice, the overarching conspiracy proves difficult to dismantle, leaving him questioning his own methods and the possibility of true redemption.
